newsitem.title: UK: Alliance & Leicester sets post-float high.
newsitem.headline: Alliance & Leicester sets post-float high.

text.p: Shares in banking group Alliance & Leicester Plc advanced to a post-flotation high on Thursday as a shortage of the stock in the market squeezed the share price higher, dealers said.

At one stage in mid-morning trade, the shares jumped to 600p, their highest level since share dealings started on April 21. By 0908 GMT, Alliance's shares had risen 10-1/2p to 596p in volume of over one million shares.
The stock opened at a higher-than-expected 522-1/8p on its debut and closed at 566-1/2p that day.

Dealers said buyers were still chasing the shares, encouraged by the recent gains in the UK banking sector and the need for investment funds to increase their weight in the sector ahead of the Halifax flotation expected on June 2.
Research group Citywatch said last week that Mercury Asset Management Plc had acquired a stake in Alliance of at least 6.26 per cent -- making it A&L's biggest single shareholder.
Although dealers said no new bid rumours were circulating in the market on Thursday, analysts have said that MAM's stake could suggest it believes Alliance is susceptible to a takeover bid.
